intro: Manihot tubuliflora, commonly known as the tubular-flowered manioc, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds.
